729068-d-12-02-11-CC.Narrative: UP TRAIN, YCB65, WAS CONDUCTING SWITCHING OPERATIONS ON THE CC'S DIAMOND. THE DIAMOND IS NOT TO BE USED AS A SUPPLEMENTAL SWITCHING LEAD AS THEY WERE USING IT. THE TRAIN CONSIST WAS MADE UP OF 34 CARSNEAR THE HEAD OF THE TRAIN. THE CARS DID NOT HAVE AIR ON THEM WHICH CONTRIBUTED TO THE BUFFING. THECARS THAT DERAILED IN THE CONSIST AT THE DIAMOND HAPPENED TO BE THE EMPTY CARS AHEAD OF THE BLOCK OF LOADED CARS. THE SWITCHING MOVE ACROSS THIS DIAMOND ALONG WITH THE LOADED CARS SLACK ACTION INTO THE EMPTY CARS THAT WERE LOCATED ON THE DIAMOND RESULTED IN THE DERAILMENT. NO EXCEPTION WAS TAKEN WITH THE CC'S TRACK. UP ESTIMATED $29,755 IN EQUIPMENT DAMAGE. RAILROADS DO NOT AGREE ON CAUSE.

80011S007-d-12-08-11-IMSA.Narrative: JOB 9 PULLED CARS FROM THE SOUTH END OUT OF 811/812 USING THE 202 LEAD. JOB 9 USED THE 53 CROSSOVERTHE SHOVE INTO THE 300 TRACKS. THE CONDUCTOR LINED THE SOUTH 53 CROSSOVER SWITCH FOR OTHER THAN CROSSOVER MOVEMENT AND LEFT THE NORTH 53 CROSSOVER SWITCH LINED FOR CROSSOVER MOVEMENT. THE CONDUCTOR DID THIS BECAUSE JOB 7 WAS PULLING OUT OF 810 FROM THE SOUTH END AS SOON AS THEY CLEARED UP AND ASSUMED THAT JOB 7 WAS GOING TO USE THE SAME CROSSOVER SWITCH. ONCE JOB 9 CLEARED UP, JOB 7 PULLED 810 FROM THE SOUTH END. THE CONDUCTOR USED THE 52 CROSSOVER INTO THE 201 LEAD, INSTEAD OF USING THE 202 LEAD AND THEN SHOVING THROUGH THE 53 CROSSOVER FOR THE SHOVING MOVEMENT. ONCE JOB 7 CLEARED UP PAST THE52 CROSSOVER SWITCH, THE CONDUCTOR LINED BOTH 52 CROSSOVER SWITCHES FOR OTHER THAN CROSSOVER MOVEMENT. THE CONDUCTOR GOT INTO POSITION TO WATCH THE SHOVE INTO TRACK 405. THE CONDUCTOR FAILED TO VERIFY HIS LINE-UP AND NEVER LINED THE NORTH 53 CROSSOVER SWITCH FOR OTHER THAN CROSSOVER MOVEMENT. THE CONDUCTOR BROUGHT THE MOVE BACK TO A COUPLE, SHOVED BACK 60+ CARS AND MADE A SEPARATION. AFTER MAKINGTHE UNCOUPLING THE CARS MOVED APPROXIMATELY 7-8 CARS. THE ENGINEER FELT A TUG AND WENT INTO EMERGENCY. IT WAS DISCOVERED THAT 6 CARS HAD DERAILED.

000098909-d-12-20-11-CSX.Narrative: CONRAIL EQUIPMENT DAMAGE 32520.00. CONRAIL SP19 WAS TRAVELING WEST ON MAIN TRACK. TRAIN DEPARTED WITH A MEDIUM APPROACH SIGNAL AT CP FALLS AND THEN ENCOUNTERED AN APPROACH SIGNAL AT CP RIVER. CP BELMONT WAS AT STOP WHEN THE TRAIN ROUNDED THE CURVE. AN ENGINEER INITIATED EMERGENCY WAS APPLIED AS THESIGNAL CAME INTO VIEW. THE ENGINEER WAS THROTTLING UP AND INCREASING SPEED FROM THE MEDIUM APPROACHSIGNAL TO AND INCLUDING THE STOP SIGNAL. THE EMERGENCY APPLICATION OF THE BRAKES WAS INITIATED VIA THE ENGINEERS BRAKE VALVE HANDLE, THE ENGINEER AT NO TIME ACTUATED (BAILED OFF) THE INDEPENDENT BRAKE, THIS ACTION RESULTED IN CREATING EXTREME IN TRAIN FORCES (EXCESSIVE RUN IN) WHICH CAUSED 10 CARS TO DERAIL. NORFOLK SOUTHERN REPORT # 097490.

1211NP027-d-12-29-11-UP.Narrative: THE GKCPNP-26 CAME ONTO THE NORTH BELT WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO SPOT AG VALLEY CO-OP.  BEFORE SHOVING THE REAR OF THE TRAIN ONTO THE AG VALLEY CO-OP LEAD THE CONDUCTOR LINED THE SWITCHES TO TRACK 825 THECO-OP NORTH TRACK, AND HE LINED THE 819 TRAILING POINT SWITCH INTO 819 THINKING 819 WAS THE AG VALLEY CO-OP LEAD THAT THE TRAIN WAS GOING TO BE SHOVED INTO.  THEY SHOVED THE REAR OF THE TRAIN INTO 825TO MAKE THEIR FIRST CUT RUNNING THRU THE 819 SWITCH NOT LINED FOR THEIR MOVEMENT AND AFTER MAKING THE CUT THEY PULLED THE TRAIN AHEAD TO LINE THE NEXT SWITCH DERAILING 5 CARS OF THE TRAIN.

AS THE LEFTWHEELS DROPPED OFF THE RAIL THE CARS TO LEANED TO THE LEFT ALLOWING THE LOAD TO FALL OFF OF THE CARS.

731396-d-12-29-11-IC.Narrative: L52471-29 WAS PERFORMING ROUTINE SWITCH WHEN THEY CORNERED 2 CARS AT THE #5 SWITCH IN DESTREHAN YARD. THEY DID NOT KNOW IT HAD HAPPENED AND DID NOT REPORT IT AT THE TIME. A CARMAN IN DESTREHAN YARD WAS WORKING THE L51671-29 PICK UP AND DISCOVERED THAT THE TCIX 21099 EMPTY RESIDUE HAD DAMAGE TO THE END PLATFORM AND HAND RAIL ON THE B-END OF THE CAR. THIS WAS REPORTED TO THE TRAINMASTER. AFTER INVESTIGATION THEY FOUND ANOTHER CAR DAMAGED ON TRACK DE14 UTLX 665763 EMPTY RESIDUE. THAT HAD DAMAGE TOTHE END CAP ON THE A-END. INVESTIGATION FOUND THAT L52471-29 HAD KICKED TCIX 21099 INTO TRACK 5 ANDTHEN PROCEEDED TO KICK A CUT OF 4 CARS INTO TRACK 14. TCIX 21099 WAS NOT IN THE CLEAR AND WAS CORNERED BY UTLX 665763.

DS03611-d-12-26-11-EIRR.Accident Cause: Buffing or slack action excessive, train handling
DS03611-d-12-26-11-EIRR.Narrative: ON 12/26 TRAIN CREW AT MINIDOKA IDAHO WAS PREPARING TO BRING THE INBOUND UP TRAIN TO RUPERT THE INBOUND CONSIST OF 2 CUTS OF CARS (TOTALING 119 CARS) IN TRACK 116 SPLIT CROSSING. A REVERSE MOVE WAS MADE TO ATTACK THE CUT OF CARS ON THE EAST SIDE OF A CROSSING. ON THE EAST SIDE OF 116 TRAIN WAS THENPULLED PAST THE CROSSING TO CLEAR IN ORDER TO SWAP CREWS. WHILE STOPPING THE TRAIN THE BACK ROLLED IN THE TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY DIE TO TRAIN HANDLING DERAILING AT LEAST 1 CAR. AFTER THE ENGINEERSSWAPPED CONTROLS THEY DID NOT HAVE A THOROUGH JOB BRIEFING WITH THE 1ST AND 2ND TEAM MEMBERS ON THEGROUND.  THE CONDUCTORS WERE UNAWARE OF THE EMERGENCY APPLICATION. FIRST CREW DEPARTED MINIDOKA ANDTHE SECOND CREW BEGAN TO PULL THE TRAIN DOWN 116 AND THE MOVEMENT WAS STOPPED DUE TO THE INABILITY TO PULL. UPON INSPECTING THE TRAIN IT WAS FOUND THAT 10 CARS HAD BEEN DERAILED.
